intro: Angelphytum pseudosilphioides, commonly known as the false sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, fleshy leaves and delicate, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Angelphytum pseudosilphioides is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, making it a unique component of desert ecosystems.
